title: Red Hat Enterprise Linux Self-paced Labs

tracks.title: Configuring Terminal Session Recording
tracks.description: Keep track of what is happening on your systems by using Terminal Session Recording to record and review terminal sessions of users and administrators.

tracks.title: Managing software from an application stream
tracks.description: Learn how to choose versions of popular and supported open source languages and offer them to users through an application stream.

tracks.title: Helpful Linux Commands [Admin 101]
tracks.description: Add a few essential commands to your Linux toolbox.

tracks.title: Building a standard operating environment with RHEL System Roles
tracks.description: Use RHEL System Roles to create and apply a standard set of configuration for systems using Ansible-based RHEL System Roles.

tracks.title: Deploying containers using Container Tools [podman]
tracks.description: Deploy and run container images using the utilities included in the RHEL Container Tools.

tracks.title: Using file permissions [Admin 101]
tracks.description: Control access to file content using the Linux file permission system.

tracks.title: Red Hat Enterprise Linux with SQL Server Columnstores
tracks.description: Improve SQL Server performance by using Red Hat Enterprise Linux performance tools and SQL Server Columnstores.

tracks.title: Performance observability in practice with bcc-tools
tracks.description: Collect data on various system activities, such as disk performance, latency, and more using the bcc-tools.  This data can help identify issues with application performance.

tracks.title: Manage user accounts and groups [Admin 101]
tracks.description: Create users and groups, adjust memberships, and recommended practices for disabling accounts.

tracks.title: Using Web Console to build virtual machine images [Image Builder]
tracks.description: Learn how to manage virtual machines produced for different providers through a single, Web Console included application.

tracks.title: Design and build virtual machine images using commandline tools [Image Builder]
tracks.description: Move into the Hybrid Cloud by building consistent virtual machines produced for virtualization or cloud providers with the composer-cli commandline tool.

tracks.title: Installing Software using Package Managers [Admin 101]
tracks.description: Learn how to use YUM and RPM to streamline installations and verify local software.

tracks.title: Build an application into a container image using RHEL Container Tools
tracks.description: Add an existing application to a Red Hat Universal Base Image (UBI) container and deploy it.

tracks.title: Resolving issues with Red Hat Insights Advisor
tracks.description: Register systems and proactively resolve potential issues with Insights Advisor.

tracks.title: Service Administration Basics [Admin 101]
tracks.description: Learn the distinction between processes, services, and daemons, as well as how to interact with them on your system.

tracks.title: Creating images with Container Tools [buildah]
tracks.description: Build containers using an existing base image or from scratch using the RHEL Container Tools

tracks.title: Reducing unplanned maintenance with Kernel Live Patching
tracks.description: Resolve Critical Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVEs) by applying Kernel Live Patches to your systems without needing to take a system downtime for maintenance.

tracks.title: Unusual Unixisms [Admin 101]
tracks.description: Learn how to avoid common pitfalls for new Linux users.

tracks.title: Using Red Hat Insights with SQL Server
tracks.description: Improve performance by discovering and remediating issues using Red Hat Insights for your running workloads

tracks.title: Managing system updates using the web console
tracks.description: Explore how someone with limited Linux experience can apply system updates to Red Hat Enterprise Linux systems through this user friendly web interface.

tracks.title: Configuring Network Interfaces [Admin 101]
tracks.description: Learn how to apply network settings to interfaces and manage connections using Network Manager and the nmcli command.

tracks.title: Generate container-specific SELinux settings
tracks.description: Use the RHEL Container Tools to generate custom SELinux security profiles for a containerized application.

tracks.title: Using Web Console to Monitor Performance
tracks.description: Monitor system performance using the RHEL web console

tracks.title: Performance Co-Pilot (PCP) on Red Hat Enterprise Linux
tracks.description: Use PCP on RHEL to capture and analyze system and application metrics

tracks.title: Configuring the system-wide cryptographic policy
tracks.description: Enforce more complex ciphers, protocol versions, and usable ciphers across all services running on your machines.

tracks.title: Customize the system-wide cryptographic policy
tracks.description: Create your own customized system-wide cryptographic policy to suit your environment while still applying the policy to all applications that utilize the cryptographic libraries with Red Hat Enterprise Linux.

tracks.title: Red Hat Enterprise Linux Crypto Policy and Transparent Data Encryption (TDE) With SQL Server
tracks.description: Use Microsoft SQL Server with RHEL system-wide crypto policies and configure TDE.

tracks.title: Terminal Session Recording and SQL Server Auditing
tracks.description: Enable and review recorded sessions in Red Hat Enterprise Linux, and track activity inside SQL Server using it's auditing feature.

tracks.title: Installing and configuring Microsoft SQL Server on Red Hat Enterprise Linux using RHEL System Roles
tracks.description: Use Ansible powered RHEL System Roles to install and configure Microsoft SQL Server on Red Hat Enterprise Linux

tracks.title: Red Hat Enterprise Linux Open Lab
tracks.description: This lab environment has no pre-planned lab content.  It provides a place to try out Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.

tracks.title: Red Hat Enterprise Linux Firewall System Role
tracks.description: Configure your firewall with RHEL Firewall System Role.

tracks.title: Red Hat Enterprise Linux Edge Management
tracks.description: Learn how Red Hat manages edge devices.

tracks.title: File Access Policy
tracks.description: Deploy and manage application control on Red Hat Enterprise Linux systems.

tracks.title: Using OpenSCAP for security compliance and vulnerability scanning
tracks.description: Use OpenSCAP for security compliance and vulnerability scanning
